statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Samford 58, Georgia Southern 50
article.story: STATESBORO, Ga. -- Josh Davis scored 13 points and Gregg Wooten had all 12 of his points in the second half to lead Samford over Georgia Southern 58-50 on Saturday. The Bulldogs (12-12, 4-8 Southern Conference) led 33-31 with 11:52 to play before going on a 13-4 run. Davis' 3-pointer capped the spurt giving Samford its biggest lead, 46-35, with 7:16 to play. Wooten, who was 6 of 7 from the field in the second half, had six points during the run. The Bulldogs led 23-22 at halftime, and shot 57.1 percent in the second half (12 of 21). They snapped a four-game road losing skid, and won for the first time in three games. Samford, the Southern Conference's No. 2 defensive team (65.6 points per game coming in), forced 18 turnovers while committing 11, including just four in the second half. Ben Drayton scored 16 points for the Eagles (4-21, 0-12), who lost their 12th straight.
